bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Bibliographic lists by Charles H. Coles, [January, 1942]

div1.p: Coles' annotated references to publications on yellow fever were sent to Hench.

div1.head: Bibliographic lists by Charles H. Coles, [January, 1942]

list.item:
1. Walter Reed and Yellow Fever, by Howard A. Kelly, M.D.
The Norman Remington Co., Baltimore, Maryland

2. The Microbe Hunters, by Paul DeKruif. Harcourt, Brace
and Co., New York City.

3. William Crawford Gorgas.--His Life and Work, by Mar'e D.
Gorgas and Burton J. Hendrick. Doubleday, Page and Co.
4. A Doctor's Memories, by Victor C. Vaughan. The Bobbs Merrill Co.

5. Health Heroes--Walter Reed, by Grace T. Hallock and C. E. Turner.
Metropolitan Life Insurance Co., New York City. (This last
interesting pamphlet will be sent free to any teacher who
asks for it.)

6. Annual Reports of the Rockefeller Foundation. 61 Broadway,
New York City.

7. Memories of a Yellow Fever Martyr, by Homer Croy. The World's
Work for December, 1927. Doubleday, Page and Co.,
Garden City, New York.

div1.p:
Yellow Fever References:
Bulletin Yellow Fever Bureau. (Including Dengue and Pappataci Fever)
Volumes I - III. 1911-1915. The Incorporated Liverpool School
of Tropical Medicine. All Published. Liverpool. Univ. Press.
*Yellow Fever - Kentucky. Bulletin of the Kentucky Geological Survey
No. 1. (Frankfort) Yeoman Office (1879)
Freire, Dr. Domingos: Memoire sur la Bacteriologie, Pathogenie, traite-
ment et Prophylaxie de la Fievre Jaune - preśenté
au Congrés International D'Hygiene et Demegraphie
de Madrid. 1898. 4o.
" " " Réfutation des Recherches aur la Fiévre Jaune. 8vo. 1888
Hastings, Dr. John: Lectures on Yellow Fever, Its Causes, Pathology & Treat-
ment. 8vo. 1848.
*Procter, John Robert: Notes on the Yellow Fever Epidemic at Hickman, Ky. 1878
Frankfort, Ky. E.H. Porter. printer. 1879. 41 pp
(*Same report appeared in Bulletin 1. Geological Survey as pp. 61-98)
Tytler, James: An Interesting Account of the Dreadful Effects of the Plague
and Yellow Fever, at London, in 1665; at Athens in the time
of the Peloponesian War; at Constantinople, in the time of
Justinian; and at Marseilles in 1720, &c.
First American Edition taken from the 21st. London Edition
8vo. 1824
de Jennés, Alex. Mereau: Notice sur les Enquëtes Officielles Constatant la
Contagion de la Fiévre Jaune et de la Peste.
IN Tracts Volume I. J.R.L. von Kirckhoff & Others
5.04 8vo. Paris. 1825
Yellow Fever References: 2
Figure(5) Stegemyia fasciata, F. (or Aëdes argenteus, Poieret)
The only carrier of yellow fever
SEE, 'Mosquitoes and their Relation to Disease 8 etc. by
F.W. Edwards. 3rd. Edition. Economic Series No. 4.
British Museum (Natural History) 8vo. 1923
Finlay, Dr. Carlos J. Trabajos Selecos - Selected Papers
657 pp. Habana. 8vo. 1912
LePrince, Joseph A.
& Orenstein, A.J. Mosquito Control in Panama. The Eradication
of Malaria and Yellow Fever in Cuba and Panama.
G.P. Putman's Sons. 8vo. 1916
Boyce, Sir Rubert W. Mosquito or Man? The Conquest of the Tropical
World. John Murray, London. 8vo. 1909.
(Chapters X. Yellow Fever - Dr. Beauperthuy on Tradition
in Medicine and His View of the Mode of Transmission of
Yellow Fever. Harrison & Moxley on the Nature of the
Virus of Yellow Fever: XI. Histerical Survey of Yellow
Fever. Its Destructive Spread and Mortality during the
17th. and 18th Centuries: XII. Discovery of the Mode
of Transmission if Yellow Fever, and Plan of Campaign
against the Mosquito.
Dr. Charles A. R. Campbell in his book entitles ‘Bats, Mosquitoes and Dollars’
8ve. The Stratford Co. Boston. 1925 states on pages 189-191
that “Ancient Information Concerning the Dragon Fly's
Value” existed in the State of Cordova in Mexico.
The flies arriving in huge swarms devoured the mosquitoes
and that the natives knew that yellow fever would then
disappear.
Figure (28) SIPHON of Aëdes (Stegemyia) argenteus
SEE page 126 Malcolm E. Macgregor - Mosquito Surveys, a
A Handbook for Anti-Malarial and Anti-Mosquiot Field Workers
Published by The Wellcome Bureau of Sci. Research. London. 1927
Goeldi, Dr. Emilio Augusto - Os Mosquitos ne Pará. Memorias de Museau Goeldi
(Museu Paraense) de Historia Naturale Ethnographia. IV.
Para. 4o. 1905. Has Chapter 4 as follows: “Stegemyia
fasciata,
e mosquito transmissor da febre amarella, e o actual estado
de conhecimentos sobre a causa d'esta molestia. (Conferencia
realisada perante a Congresso Internacional de Zoologia em
Berna (Suissa) Agosto 1904”)
Yellow Fever References: 3
Hegh, E. Les Moustiques. Moeurs et Moyens de Destruction. 2e. Edition
Bruxelles. 8vo. 1921. Has excellent Bibliography
and a fiture of both male and female Stegemyia
fasciata at page 24
Ross, Edward Halford: The Reduction of Domestic Mosquitoes. Instructions for
the Use of Municipalities, Town Councils, Health
Officers, Sanitary Inspectors, and Residents in
Warm Climates. London. 8vo. John Murray. 1911
Has ‘Plan of Breeding-Places of domestic mosquitoes
at New Orleans*’ after Boyce) at page 51
Howard, L. O.; Dyar, H.G. &
Knab, Frederick
The Mosquitoes of North and Central America
and the West Indies. 4 volumes. Carnegie
Institution of Washington. 4o. 1912-
